image.altText: A woman wearing a black t-shirt, standing next to a tall man, orange shirt, straw hat and eye-patch. Standing on front porch.

props.synopsis: Darwin, Australia's smallest capital city, has been ranked the country's second-most-expensive place to rent a house, along with Canberra. A local shelter says the city is in desperate need of more affordable housing.

title.children: Darwin becomes second-most-expensive capital city to rent a house

image.altText: USS Minnesota Darwin Harbour

props.synopsis: American officials have continued to voice their concerns about the agreement signed with Beijing-controlled Landbridge since the election of Donald Trump.

title.children: PM signals 'more to say' about China's controversial Darwin Port lease

image.altText: The exterior of the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre, with barbed wire in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Four former detainees who were tear gassed at Darwin's notorious Don Dale Youth Justice Centre in 2014 have had their $1 million compensation payout slashed on appeal.

title.children: $1 million payout for tear-gassed Don Dale detainees slashed on appeal

props.synopsis: A seasonal shift after a sweltering summer has led to a slew of road closures across Central Australia, blocking off access routes.

title.children: Waterfalls flow from Uluru as Central Australia welcomes heavy rain

image.altText: A design of the new civic centre building.

props.synopsis: The Darwin city council will soon begin building a $150 million CBD high-rise to replace its aging civic centre, in partnership with property developer DCOH.

title.children: $150m high-rise to replace Darwin city council headquarters

image.altText: A pile of flood debris in front of a green house. A red helicopter flies over.

props.synopsis: Study calls for for state and federal leaders to help home owners future-proof their properties before they're lost entirely.

title.children: Insurance can't keep building 'like for like' after disasters, study finds

image.altText: A submarine moves through the water causing a massive wake behind it, some crew visible above deck.

props.synopsis: The United Kingdom launches a parliamentary inquiry into the AUKUS partnership, with its scope to include the "impact of geopolitical shifts" on the deal since it was signed.

title.children: Britain launches AUKUS parliamentary inquiry amid 'geopolitical shifts'

image.altText: A middle aged woman with her sleeve rolled up and a bandaid on her arm.

props.synopsis: The shingles vaccine could be an effective intervention for dementia, with a large "natural experiment" in Wales finding a substantial drop in dementia risk for those who received the vaccine.

title.children: Shingles vaccine study finds 'huge protective signal' against dementia

image.altText: Video designed by SCJ

props.synopsis: Shincheonji calls itself a religious organisation based on the teachings of the Bible, but former members say there is a much darker side — one that consumes its members' lives, controls their movements and uses threats of divine retribution to prevent them from leaving.

title.children: From Bible study to 'brainwashed': How an international church is recruiting

image.altText: A man in graduation outfit.

props.synopsis: Students and union groups fear their interests could be targeted under a Coalition crackdown on "woke" ideology in schools and universities.

title.children: Free speech fears over Coalition's 'woke' education pledge

image.altText: A head-and-shoulders shot of Allegra Spender, in a yellow blazer with shoulder-length black hair.

props.synopsis: Independent Allegra Spender is pitching a scheme to help "permanently" cut the power bills of owners and renters through zero-interest loans for home batteries and other appliances, saying the major parties are only offering temporary relief that will expire within months.

title.children: Spender says Coalition's gas plan could influence hung parliament negotiations

image.altText: Smartphone displaying the TikTok logo with a blurred, larger version in the background.

props.synopsis: A US ban on the platform is set to take effect on April 5 if it is not sold to an approved buyer.

title.children: Amazon makes last-minute bid to buy TikTok as deadline looms

image.altText: A woman wearing Islamic dress stands on a pile of rubble and concrete after an airstrike.

props.synopsis: Gaza's health ministry says children are among the dead in an Israeli strike on a UN-run clinic in the strip's north, where people had been sheltering.

title.children: Dozens killed, tens of thousands displaced as Israel signals Gaza land grab

image.altText: a silhouette of a man in a wheelchair in a room

props.synopsis: Jim* moved into an apartment rented by a disability company linked to suspected NDIS fraudster Khawaja Haroon. He's now facing homelessness and has paid thousands of dollars of his NDIS funding for services he didn't receive.

title.children: 59yo's eviction linked to suspected multi-million-dollar NDIS scam

image.altText: Elon Musk stands infront of the smashed windows of a Cybertruck

props.synopsis: Elon Musk's electric vehicle company has also been targeted by vandals in recent months amid backlash to his embrace of far-right politics.

title.children: Tesla quarterly sales plummet amid Elon Musk backlash

image.altText: A woman wearing a black t-shirt, standing next to a tall man, orange shirt, straw hat and eye-patch. Standing on front porch.

props.synopsis: Darwin, Australia's smallest capital city, has been ranked the country's second-most-expensive place to rent a house, along with Canberra. A local shelter says the city is in desperate need of more affordable housing.

title.children: Australia's smallest capital city has second highest rental house prices

image.altText: Peter Reith and John Howard in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister John Howard has always downplayed involvement in the waterfront dispute, but new evidence raises more questions about the government's knowledge of the events leading up to it.

title.children: New evidence about 1998 waterfront dispute

image.altText: Val Kilmer and Tom Cruise in a happy scene from Top Gun.

props.synopsis: Since they met on the set of Top Gun in 1986 as bitter fictional rivals, Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer have shared a close friendship.

title.children: 'I'm still your wingman': The 39-year friendship of Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer

image.altText: The former foster father of Kaydence Mills holds a photo album of the toddler.

props.synopsis: Two-year-old Kaydence Mills was killed by her stepfather Tane Desatge at Chinchilla on the Western Downs in 2017 — just months after child protection services returned her to her biological mother, Sinitta Dawita.

title.children: Inquest to probe murder of toddler whose death wasn't noticed for years

image.altText: close up of a woman's blotchy face

props.synopsis: A customer suffering a severe reaction to a skincare balm says she warned Kmart a month before a teen was hospitalised.

title.children: Calls for regulation as another Kmart customer experiences skin damage

image.altText: Map showing the path of a cyclone heading towards the Queensland coastline.

props.synopsis: An AI forecast about ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred's path was far more accurate than leading weather models used by meteorological organisations.

title.children: AI picked Cyclone Alfred hitting Qld before traditional weather models

image.altText: A map showing bushfire emergency and watch and act warning areas for parts of Ferndale in Perth, marked in red and yellow.

props.synopsis: Homes have been evacuated in the Perth suburb of Ferndale after an emergency-level bushfire broke out in the early hours of the morning, with residents under threat urged to leave now if it is safe to do so.

title.children: Breaking: Homes evacuated as fire prompts emergency warning in Perth's south

image.altText: Tasmanian restauraunt Mures signage

props.synopsis: Hobart seafood business Mures Tasmania stops serving Tasmanian salmon in its restaurant due to "concerns" over industry practices, which have drawn national attention in recent months.

title.children: Iconic Hobart seafood restaurant removes Tasmanian salmon from menu

image.altText: a small animal with pointed nose, brown fur and white spots

props.synopsis: Despite anecdotal sightings of quolls, months of camera trapping surveys failed to find any evidence of the animals across more than 100,000 hectares of land in Queensland.

title.children: 'Mini leopard' of Aussie bush 'functionally' extinct in areas of Qld

image.altText: hands hold an orange alarm clock against a blue background

props.synopsis: Daylight saving finishes for people in NSW, Victoria, South Australia, Tasmania and the ACT and won't return until October 5.

title.children: Daylight saving time is ending this Sunday. Here's what to know

image.altText: A still from a Studio Ghibli animated film showing a young girl in traditional Japanese dress.

props.synopsis: The frenzy to create Ghibli-style art using ChatGPT has sparked a heated debate about the ethical concerns of AI-generated art, copyright issues and the future livelihoods of artists.

title.children: Why is the ChatGPT 'Studio Ghibli' trend problematic?

image.altText: Back of a woman's head, her hair tied up in a ponytail, in a room with a display cabinet and TV on the wall

props.synopsis: Despite the growing number of adult female prisoners across Australia, advocates say there are few gender-specific support services to help them transition back into the community.

title.children: Women leaving prison are 'falling through the cracks', advocates say

image.altText: Three young people walking through thick mud left from flood waters

props.synopsis: In a reprieve for weather-weary Queenslanders rainfall is set to ease, but floodwaters will linger for days at least as graziers start to calculate the full extent of livestock losses.

title.children: Rainfall to ease in outback Queensland but flooding continues

image.altText: People voting at Dalkeith pollling station.

props.synopsis: The WA government's move to hold a special inquiry backed by all the major parties into the management of the March state election shows what's a stake — public trust in the democratic process.

title.children: WA's democratic process under scrutiny in unprecedented election probe

image.altText: Rescuers carry out search and rescue on damaged buildings in the aftermath of an earthquake.

props.synopsis: State-run media in Myanmar announces the military's ceasefire call, which comes after days of pressure from international aid groups and humanitarian organisations.

title.children: Myanmar military announces temporary ceasefire following earthquake

image.altText: Firefighters watch a high energy fire in the Grampians area of western Victoria

props.synopsis: Legislation to replace Victoria's Fire Services Levy with an expanded tax could be voted through by the Legislative Council today, but farmers are calling for it to be blocked.

title.children: Fire levy changes have Victorian farmers fuming ahead of vote

image.altText: Daria Kasatkina celebrates with both arms in the air

props.synopsis: Daria Kasatkina, Australia's newest tennis star, overcomes the stress of switching allegiances in a straight-sets win.

title.children: Daria Kasatkina wins 'stressful' debut as an Australian player

props.synopsis: The power of the unions has always been a huge battleground for Labor and the Coalition. Now there are revelations about the role former prime minister John Howard and his ministers played in one of the most divisive industrial disputes in Australia.

title.children: The secrets of John Howard's war on the docks
